meanings.definition: Having a porous or spongy structure, as in cancellous bone.
meanings.sent1: The cancellous sponge soaked up the water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The cancellous bone in the body helps to absorb shock.
meanings.sent3: The cancellous mattress felt like sleeping on a cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a cancellous sponge, absorbing new information effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The cancellous material was so soft and airy, like a gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling cancelli, as in cancellous tissue.
meanings.sent1: The cancellous tissue had a unique pattern under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The cancellous structure of the plant allowed for efficient nutrient absorption.
meanings.sent3: The cancellous fabric looked like a tiny maze of threads.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like cancellous tissue, interconnected and complex.
meanings.sent5: The cancellous design of the building made it stand out among the rest.
